google_play_reviews.replyContent: Today most of the network traffic is encrypted. To be able to inspect the traffic you need the TLS decryption https://emanuele-f.github.io/PCAPdroid/tls_decryption

google_play_reviews.content: Only one tht works Wish it could see Hotspot traffic

I have had a similar experience as Hethe Berg, as in when I use the app to try to troubleshoot why certain apps won't work on my Wi-Fi, the apps magically work and connect ONLY when I use PCAPdroid. So it does not capture the PCAP of the connection issue. Really curious what is going on here. First thought was I have malware and it stops running when someone tries to capture data of it working, but scans come up empty and it makes no sense why only some apps are affected. AMC+ is one of them.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, in order to work without root, PCAPdroid needs to change your traffic at the IP and TCP layer. On Android a 1:1 view of the traffic is only possible with root, please check out https://emanuele-f.github.io/PCAPdroid/quick_start#14-packet-analysis for more details

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent insights into network traffic on device. Pcap addition is nice, decrypting traffic is even better! Firewall included and shut up and take my money

google_play_reviews.content: Why is it requesting access to my microphone? Edit: yes it does. Several other security apps are flagging this as attempting to access my microphone. Developer is being dishonest or they are compromised. Either way, doesn't inspire confidence in their response to my initial post
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app does not require such a permission. Edit: which are such apps detecting the microphone request from PCAPdroid? All the permissions which an app can request are reported in the app manifest, which for PCAPdroid is https://github.com/emanuele-f/PCAPdroid/blob/playstore/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml . You can see there is no mic permission

google_play_reviews.content: Emulates vpn. Please add this info to description.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please note that PCAPdroid simulates a VPN in order to capture the network traffic without root. It does not use a remote VPN server. All the data is processed locally on the device. Read more: https://emanuele-f.github.io/PCAPdroid/quick_start

I really love it but I hate when I want to check traffic of already connected VPN and it also request for VPN connection, so how 2 vpns can be connected at the same time so that's why giving it 4 stars because I can't get host from Psiphon via this app because it also requests for VPN connection üòû
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thanks for your feedback. Sadly this is a limitation of the Android API. If you want to capture traffic while other vpn apps are running, you will need a rooted device

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and usefull. Thanks to create this app

Good sniffing tool for non toot devicr
Thanks for your work and sharing the source. Amazing app.

Good app, limited in some way by the policies of Android itself. Does shows [Ad]s, however please consider a grace period of even a couple of days. A "Pro" version without the dependencies would be good. Thanks for providing the git.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I'm sorry to hear an enthusiast user becoming so unhappy, here is my explanation for the changes. The apk size increased due to the intergration of geoip dbs, which allows PCAPdroid to show the country for an IP address. Ads/iap help foster the app development. About half of the IAP price is taxes/fees. You can find foss/old apks on github.

google_play_reviews.content: In addition to being able to filter in only blocked connections, would also be nice to have a filter option to filter out all blocked connections. UPDATE 6/23/2022 - Thanks for adding my requested feature so quickly Emanuele, you now have 5 stars. Awesome app!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the suggestion, PCAPdroid 1.5.2 now has a filter to only show the allowed connections

google_play_reviews.content: Cannot decrypt SSL payload
google_play_reviews.replyContent: SSL decryption is not an easy topic on Android, please check out the user guide https://emanuele-f.github.io/PCAPdroid/tls_decryption and if you still have issues ask the community on telegram

Another great free app - my adblock list was causing issues with a some apps logging in & PCAPdroid allowed me to log network traffic from said apps, which meant I was able to then compare those domains with my blacklist & whitelist them, fixing the login issues with said apps. Thank you.
Perfect! Exactly what I needed. Thanks :)
can't read request content
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app shows the HTTP request but if the connection is encrypted (TLS/HTTPS) you need to decrypt it as explained in https://emanuele-f.github.io/PCAPdroid/tls_decryption#31-decrypt-https/tls

google_play_reviews.content: Nice bodge for a rootless tcpdump-less phone. Still a useful standalone tool for high-level monitoring and/or logging even without that. Thanks!
Great tool set to help detect spyware &data bleeds easily.
I love this!!! Thank you, it's extremely useful.
Great. Finally found what i was looking for. Can easily find the ip addresses i need to set to my traffic rules. Great app so far.

Better than what I was expecting! I really needed to see UDP traffic more than anything and boom! This app does just that (and more)! I'm even surprised the app doesn't default to hiding itself from DNS lookups and what not. Impressive!

I've been trying to hack my smart bulbs and this app help me understand what the bulb controller app was doing

PCAPdroid is an amazing tool that gives you an ultimate insight into exactly what various installed applications on you device are sending and receiving. It's very easy to use, requires no complicated setup, and seems to capture everything. The UI is simple enough, but it also has the ability to export pcap files which can then be opened in any capture viewer, like Wireshark. All in all, this app is awesome both for beginners and pros, it's well built, 5/5 would recommend!
It's useless! I need api response and it gives me some usless information about connection time!
Best app to capture app network traffic with no CA certificate
